file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 27-51-00-02 - FLAP - MECHANICAL LINE - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL FLAP - MECHANICAL LINE - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedure to put the flap actuators back to a serviceable condition. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY GREASE FITTING OF THE FLAP ACTUA- ALL 27-51-00-960-801-A TOR - REPLACEMENT EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 27-51-00 Page 1 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 27-51-00-960-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. GREASE FITTING OF THE FLAP ACTUATOR - REPLACEMENT A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to put the flap actuators back to a serviceable condition, after you replace the grease fitting of the FSA. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION ENERGIZATION OF THE AIRCRAFT WITH AN EX- AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200 TERNAL POWER SOURCE FLAP SCREWJACK ACTUATOR (FSAS) - LUBRICA- AMM TASK 27-51-00-600-801-A/300 TION AMM TASK 27-51-09-000-802-A/400 INBOARD FLAP TIP ACTUATOR (FSA 2) - REMOVAL INBOARD FLAP TIP ACTUATOR (FSA 2) - INSTALLA- AMM TASK 27-51-09-400-802-A/400 TION OUTBOARD FLAP ROOT ACTUATOR (FSA 3) - RE- AMM TASK 27-51-10-000-801-A/400 MOVAL OUTBOARD FLAP ROOT ACTUATOR (FSA 3) - IN- AMM TASK 27-51-10-400-801-A/400 STALLATION NAS516-1A - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 571 571AB/BB Inboard Flap - Left Wing 572 572AB/BB Inboard Flap - Right Wing 671 671AB/BB Outboard Flap - Left Wing 672 672AB/BB Outboard Flap - Right Wing D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY To remove the grease fitting from the gimbal GSE 401 Grease fitting extractor of the actuator E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially To install the GSE in the grease fitting of the Allen wrench, 9/16 in-dia 1 available actuator gimbal Commercially To install the grease fitting in the actuator Punch, 4 mm (5/32 inch)-dia 1 available gimbal EMB-145 - AMM 1285 960-801-A/200 27-51-00 Page 2 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MIL-PRF-81322 Commercially available AR G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Lubrication Fitting NAS516-1A AR H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Wing trailing edge I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Energize the aircraft with an External DC Power Supply ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). (2) Set the flaps to the 45-degree position. (3) On the circuit breaker panel, open the FLAP 1 and FLAP 2 circuit breakers and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to them. (4) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (5) If necessary, remove the protection cover to get access to the gimbal of the inboard flap tip actuator ( AMM TASK 27-51-09-000-802-A/400). (6) If necessary, remove the protection cover to get access to the gimbal of the outboard flap root actuator ( AMM TASK 27-51-10-000-801-A/400). J. Replacement of the Grease Fitting of the Flap Actuator (Figure 201) SUBTASK 960-002-A (1) Install the grease fitting extractor (GSE 401) in the grease fitting. Refer to Figure 201, Sheet 2. • Make sure that the grease fitting extractor is correctly attached to the grease fitting. (2) Turn the extractor counterclockwise. Refer to Figure 201, Sheet 2. • Make sure that no chips go into the ballnut. (3) Use the slide hammer of the grease fitting extractor to remove the grease fitting. Refer to Figure 201, Sheet 2. (4) Remove the grease fitting from the ballnut. Refer to Figure 201, Sheet 2. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 960-801-A/200 27-51-00 Page 3 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (5) If necessary, cut the grease fitting to make sure that you removed the ball and the spring • If you do not find the ball and the spring of the grease fitting, you must remove the actuator from the aircraft and install a new actuator. (6) Clean the ballnut with a clean cloth. (7) Apply some new grease to the ballnut. CAUTION: MAKE SURE THAT THE PUNCH DOES NOT CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE ACTUATOR. (8) With the punch vertical, carefully install the new grease fitting. Refer to Figure 201, Sheet 3. (9) Lubricate the actuator (AMM TASK 27-51-00-600-801-A/300). K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) If applicable, install the protection cover of the gimbal of the inboard flap tip actuator ( AMM TASK 27-51-09-400-802-A/400). (2) If applicable, install the protection cover of the gimbal of the outboard flap root actuator ( AMM TASK 27-51-10-400-801-A/400). (3) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, close the FLAP 1 and FLAP 2 circuit breakers and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from them. (4) Set the flaps to the 0-degree position. (5) Deenergize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 960-801-A/200 27-51-00 Page 4 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
